title: Jersey Shore favorite named one of country’s 25 most popular beach towns
body: Asbury Park was named one of the 25 most popular beach towns in the United States by Newsweek. Greetings from one of the 25 most popular beach towns in the United States., one of the crown jewels of the Jersey Shore and a New Jersey cultural institution for beaches as well as its arts and dining scene, was recently featured on Newsweek’s list of the , alongside such towns as Haleiwa in Hawaii, Narragansett in Rhode Island and Ocean City in Maryland.“The famous Jersey Shore is lined with sandy beaches and quiet towns, such as the small seaside community Asbury Park,” Newsweek wrote. “But there is more to the town than its Instagram-able beachside, as Asbury Park also boasts a vibrant art and music scene and an assortment of independent boutique shops.”There’s no question that Asbury Park deserves a place on the list. It is fair to question if Newsweek has been to town recently if they think of it as a “small seaside community,” but alas. It’s also fair to wonder why New Jersey, a state known by many primarily for its beaches and beach towns — enough for a  every summer  — has just one representative on the list.No love for Cape May, twice named the best beach in New Jersey by NJ.com? What about Point Pleasant Beach, which recently won NJ.com’s Jersey Shore Madness bracket?In fairness, there are a lot of beaches around the country that need representation. They’re just not as good as the Jersey Shore.Note to readers: if you purchase something through one of our affiliate links we may earn a commission.
